overview: The new Files changed experience in pull requests receives CODEOWNERS validation support, significant performance improvements (up to 67% faster interactions on large PRs), small-screen layout fixes, and several bug fixes including notification read state and sticky header issues.

detailed_explanation.title: CODEOWNERS validation
bullets: CODEOWNERS validation is now integrated into the new Files changed experience, closing a gap from the classic view.
Required reviewers are correctly surfaced based on CODEOWNERS rules.
Review requirements are accurately enforced before merge.

detailed_explanation.title: Small screen improvements
bullets: Multiple layout, spacing, and overflow issues fixed for mobile and smaller viewports.
Diffs, comments, headers, and controls now render and behave correctly on small screens.

detailed_explanation.title: Performance improvements
bullets: Pull request diffs optimized for greater responsiveness — early data shows up to 67% faster click, type, and scroll interactions on large PRs.
Virtualization is now applied only to the largest pull requests for scroll and interaction performance.
Navigation between Conversations and Files tabs improved from 10+ seconds to a few seconds.
File tree resizing is smoother and more responsive for large PRs.
High memory usage when reviewing large pull requests has been fixed.

detailed_explanation.title: Bug fixes
bullets: Opening a notification directly into Files changed now correctly marks it as read.
File diff header stickiness issue when scrolling has been fixed.
Code snippet background color in thread replies is now visually distinct from the reply background.
Error when commenting across large index differences in diffs has been fixed.

key_changes: CODEOWNERS validation added to the new Files changed experience.
Up to 67% faster interactions on large pull requests in the new files changed view.
Tab navigation (Conversations to Files) reduced from 10+ seconds to a few seconds.
Virtualization limited to only the largest pull requests.
Small-screen layout and overflow issues fixed.
Four specific bug fixes: notification read state, sticky diff headers, code snippet colors, and large index commenting errors.
impact: Teams using CODEOWNERS can now fully rely on the new Files changed experience without falling back to the classic view.
Reviewers of large pull requests will experience substantially faster page interactions.
Mobile and small-screen users gain a more usable review experience.
All pull request reviewers benefit from the notification and UI bug fixes.
caveats: Virtualization is applied only to the largest pull requests, meaning smaller PRs use standard rendering.
The 67% improvement figure is based on early data and may vary by PR size and browser.
The new Files changed experience is still in preview — additional issues may exist.
Feedback can be reported via the Files changed preview feedback discussion.
insights: The performance focus reflects that large-PR review was a key pain point in the new Files changed experience.
Adding CODEOWNERS support removes a major blocker for teams considering migration from the classic view.
The incremental rollout of fixes (weekly cadence implied by past week) suggests active iteration based on user feedback.
Safari-specific fixes indicate cross-browser compatibility is a priority for the new experience.
